job_title: Supervision Analyst in Barr, IL
pros: The staff is so supportive, and really felt valued.
cons: The pay scale was low at first.

job_title: Program Administrator in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Matching 401k/403b percentage was superb Fellow staff members, made friends for life Tuition remission (even if the degree is worthless) Beautiful main campus, great environment to walk around in You have to murder someone to get fired here
cons: Low low pay, might as well work retail Leadership: very little accountability taken by higher-ups It feels like no matter what job position you have you are always subservient to people who have no idea how to use technology You have to murder someone to get fired here (unless you're the next scapegoat and it won't be that one higher up that drags everything to halt because they know the right people) Two separate work cultures (online vs traditional) with the micromanaging one (online) winning most of the battles: the nickname given to downtown Tampa location where online was housed was "Kaplan 2.0" Very little room for growth, this is a place you get a job so you can focus on finding a better job while getting paid Apparently the former president (rhymes with 'the geese') was the "8th choice" for the position: at that point just promote from within or appoint an interim

job_title: Assistant Director of Admissions in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Flexibility Team Paid Time Off Rewarding Job with Families
cons: Micromanagement Organizational Structure No Pay Raises Poor Communication

review_title: Toxic Culture, Inefficient Leaders, and No Future
job_title: Director in Saint Leo, FL
pros: The list is getting smaller and smaller. Benefits used to be the selling point (lots of time off, retirement match, tuition remission) but they keep taking those away. Campus is gorgeous.
cons: - No pay raises unless you’re friends with someone in leadership. Benefits continue to be cut but prices increase, so you really lose money every year you work there. - Cabinet leaders are worthless. Anyone who had any type of strategic influence was already pushed out and all that’s left is mediocre at best. - A new president was needed but the Board let the last one do so much damage, I don’t think anyone could save the university at this point. - Archaic processes, initiatives, and leaders. Everything is done in an effort to replicate how it was with Dr. Kirk. No one in leadership there can recreate that era, it is long gone. So stop trying.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: The bar is set low, so you really don't have to be a strong worker to be successful there.
cons: Saint Leo is just a mess of a place, and I don't expect them to stay open very long. I worked there for several years and they've got a lot of internal logistical issues to work through, a lot of people who are not good at their jobs (but not bad enough to fire), and there's just a lot of unnecessary drama and gossip. They like to brand themselves as a "community" and "family" when the university proves time and time again that they're willing to sacrifice the best choice for the easiest choice. I would NOT recommend.

job_title: Director in Tampa, FL
pros: The people and the team and tuition reimbursement
cons: For profit mentality that creates a sales like culture

job_title: Total Rewards Coordinator in Saint Leo, FL

review_title: Not what it used to be
job_title: Director in Saint Leo, FL

review_title: They’re going to do more with less
job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: Used to be a great place to work. It’s a sinking ship.
cons: Good luck everyone there that’s making old salary, they’re eliminating these positions over time for lower pay lower benefit replacements.

job_title: Campus Safety Officer in Saint Leo, FL
pros: You will have an abundant amount of free time because there is honestly nothing to do. A monkey could do this job! Can you lock a door? Can you unlock a door? You're hired! Tuition remission is nice, and you will definitely need something to do with all that free time...
cons:
The pay is crap. This is NOT a liveable wage and upward movement doesn't help much. While the employees and the sergeants are great, and there would otherwise be zero drama... Your director will make drama out of the most minuscule issues. Bro needs to take his Nexium! For real... Drink a Sprite, eat a moon pie... Yet nothing gets done about people who are habitually late to work (like, hours late) and sometimes choose not to show up without calling. 

Do yourself a favor. Go somewhere that will benefit you and give you the ability to better yourself!

review_title: Great School, not so great work environment for admissions.
job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: The pros are definitely the AMAZING benefits, PTO, 4013b matches 9%, STD, LTD, Aflac, vision, dental, pet insurance. All great. Some of the people are really nice. Free tuition reimbursement.
cons: Terrible leadership that stems all the way down from the recent president who has transformed the school with a for-profit mentality. His primary focus is $$$ only caring about the bottom line no matter what employee gets hurt in the process. Poor office culture because no one is valued seriously. No autonomy or flexibility. No growth opportunities unless you are a “yes man”. No incentives to perform well so coworkers just do the bare minimum. Because the benefits are so great the company justifies all of the cons by saying well we give you all of these benefits so thats why there’s no raises in 5 years, except for a 1.5% raise that was cancelled out due to the insurance premium raising 3% and 20% salary reductions because of Covid for 2 months.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great small class-size university. Provides various opportunities for students.
cons: Can include more components for student facing.

job_title: Talent Development Specialist in Tampa, FL
pros: 403 b match program, time off, holiday breaks.
cons: No raises, low pay. Long commute.

job_title: Human Resources Benefits Coordinator in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Good benefits such as medical dental and vision
cons: Low pay Low grow path

job_title: Student Advisor in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Strong and rewarding student connections. Great relationships with program offices.
cons: No opportunity for growth; no raises for six years; retirement matching suspended; micromanaging in office. WFH denied, even to those on sick leave. Overworked and underpaid. Incompetent leadership and administration.

job_title: Gift Officer in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great working hours and vacations.
cons: Poor Catholic identity for a is a University that identifies itself as such.

job_title: Faculty Instructor in Tampa, FL

review_title: nice place to work if you don't care about salary
job_title: Art Director in Saint Leo, FL

job_title: Staff Member in Tampa, FL
pros: The benefits were okay, not the worst I've seen, but still on the expensive side for what the pay is.
cons: The pay is the worst because management hasn't kept up with the areas rising cost of living. base pay was around 14.50 for staff, which 5 to 10 years ago was good for the area, but now that's not even enough for rent. You can get a massive increase in pay by working closer to the city instead. Also, management and middle managers are rigid and unyielding when Covid issues hit.

job_title: Director of Education in Tampa, FL
pros: True sense of community, flexible working conditions, fun environment, great benefits/time off
cons: Traditional admissions and online enrollment receive support, education centers are not treated equally

review_title: From a dream to a nightmare in less than a year
job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros:
- You get a fair amount of vacation and sick time. 
- You get Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year and Easter off.
cons:
- Micromanagement at its worst.
- Higher Up management literally treats employees as if they are not human and have no emotions or feelings.
- higher ups literally refused to talk to any enrollment counselor of color
- If you are unhappy, fake it until you just find a new job. If you express any concerns, you will be reprimanded and threated of write ups and terminations. 
- They change your work schedule with little to no notice
- Constantly tells you that your hard work isn't hard enough.
- Believes in bullying their employees into conforming to their forever changing and contradicting rules/policies.
- Will grant time off but treat you like crap until your day off and give you "silent treatment" when you return until they get over it. 
- Constantly firing people, making a sense of uneasiness and fear for your job.
-Demands unrealistic expectations of their employees.
- Literally had a meeting with the president, allowing us to share our ideas and grievances. The NEXT day, was called into another meeting to be THREATENED and told that we don't do enough for the company and that they're not afraid to write us up or fire us. (President was not present in second meeting).
-Creates a chain of command where your complaints do not reach the right representatives. They just delete your complaints.
-The go through your teams chats and emails on a regular basis and then bring up comments said in meetings to embarrass you. Sometimes, they would even go as far as sharing your health issues or life events without your permission.
- No opportunity for raises and rarely any opportunity for promotions (and if they do promote you, it's because they fired someone over the weekend and need to replace them)

job_title: Enrollment Coordinator in Saint Leo, FL
pros: They have a great benefits package and great work life balance.
cons: Tough to move up if you don’t play into the politics. Low pay they justify by time off and benefits.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL

Management expects metrics to be hit but take nothing else into consideration with how bad marketing is and only care about how many enrollments they get even if it is not in the best interest of the students, so many people coming and going, directors favorite others and make it obvious therefore nothing you say matters, could care less about helping and being friendly. Very toxic environment now and miscommunication is the biggest issue since the directors can’t seem to communicate with each other. Its not come to work and talk on the phone. I dont even know who works there anymore.

review_title: Fun work environment, beautiful campus, and creativity encouraged.

job_title: Area Director in Newport News, VA

job_title: Customer Service/Sales in Spring Hill, FL
pros: Beautiful campus, nice students, good spirit climate.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in East Las Vegas, NV
pros: Great work environment, the job is easy as far as what they expect from you. Make sure you enroll students. There is room for growth. You get to listen to music as you work. It's a calling center atmosphere. You get free education for you, your spouse and kids. Too bad I got this job after I completed my degree and have student loans. But it is a non profit so if you plan on staying for 10 years you can possibly qualify for public service student loan forgiveness.
cons: Depending on your AD you can have a great experience or a horrible micromanage experience. Luckily my AD is awesome and he is accommodating and works with you as long as you have the vacation/sick time to cover. Hours are long from 9a-6p. But weekends are off and a 4 hour overtime shift is optional so it's give and take. After a year of employment paid week off on Christmas, plus in general other paid holidays.

job_title: Assistant Academic Advisor in Lake City, FL
pros: The pros include Educational benefits, hours, compensation, and student interaction.  I was able to attend classes as an employee benefit after about 6 months in the position.  Summer hours are hard to beat, 40 hours in 4 days, leaving Fridays open for your needs.  Compensation is better than most but when the education benefit is added, the value increases.  Interaction with the students makes this job a reason to get up every morning.  To be the one to support students to accomplish their goals and dreams is an awesome feeling.
cons: Meeting expectations of some center directors can be more than challenging making success impossible.  The position consisted of advising and recruiting.  This is a small center and the advisor is responsible for both advising and recruiting.  When trying to meet the directors expectations, the course was consistently changed mid-stream.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: 403b matching, paid holidays off, parking location, free tuition if you are willing to only attention Saint Leo, but only part time is allowed and you will still be expected to pay taxes.
cons: Channel side location is a mess! The management team/associate directors are rude, break university rules, break personal boundaries, don't allow you to take earned vacation time, Micro manages even down to bathroom breaks, has inter office romantic Affairs, inappropriate relationships, countless inappropriate conversations as well at statements, I could go on and on. It's an HR nightmare. On top of that the associate directors will force you to enroll anyone, regardless if they will even make it into the class. If you try to do the right thing for a student you will be written up. It's only about the numbers.  We have the worst and most outdated computer systems and are expected to keep up with other universities out there. The AC in the office will go out, no one cares or does anything, the interest service will go out and nothing is done, the calling system goes down and you will he expected to hand dial 200+ calls a day. It's all a mess...

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Faculty, Staff, Administration some of the nicest people on the planet.  Beautiful campus. Flexible scheduling (my department anyway). Students are polite, communicative and try hard. Able to find a niche in a lot of different teaching formats. National and global teaching possibilities.
cons: The adjunct pay, as all adjunct pay is, was low.  Lack of benefits and opportunities to advance or break into full time positions beyond entry level. Found their website difficult to navigate/explore, especially since they have so many different formats to teach.  Recently had a reorganization, so things are a little in flux right now.

job_title: Technical Services Graduate Assistant in Saint Leo, FL
pros:
The University Technical Services staff are friendly, helpful, and reliable.
Graduate Assistants are eligible for tuition reimbursement.
Gain a lot of experience dealing with end users face to face as well as gain a lot of experience in versatile hardware maintenance techniques.
Learn how to use asset management software to keep track of equipment, user information, user requests, etc.
Excellent environment to learn more about computers in general: from hardware, software, script writing, IT support, and more.
cons:
Do not expect to be paid well.
A lot of your learning will need to be either self initiated or learned on the spot - There is not a current training program for the current GA position.

review_title: Great Company, but Student Support Call Center at Channelside is a disaster
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros:
*Excellent health benefits
*Tuition Remission
*Convenient location and free parking
cons:
*Management at the Channelside location is clueless and making up things as they go. The ones who really cared about the employees and the students (instead of reports & numbers) have resigned.  

*Inter-office extramarital affairs the no one seems to care about at this Catholic institution and you might actually get promoted even if management is aware of it. (Core Values)

*It used to be a great place to work, but now we're only treated half-way decent if the managers think an Employee Satisfaction Survey is about to be administered.

*You'll only get promoted if Jeff Walsh (AVP) likes you, but he won't ever take the time to get to know you.  You're just a name on a report.

review_title: Not a good place - Lacking Integrity - Very Poor Leadership
job_title: Director in Tampa, FL
pros: Okay benefits, 403 B match, met some great people in my location.
cons: Very high stress environment. Executive leadership does not show care for employees. There has been a very high turnover rate with most being layoffs. Staff are now being furloughed, pay reduced and layed off - all at the same time administration is asking for everyone to keep quiet about it. Communication about changes is very poor and off campus staff and personnel are treated very poorly. I've been with this institution for 4 years and the last 3 have been a nightmare. I feel very disappointed and looking to make the transition from here. Take heed !!! This is not a good place to work. They do not uphold their core values AT ALL! There is no room for advancement for most positions. The pay is also very poor compared to other institutions. Not Good :(

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Employees are friendly, campus is beautiful, cafeteria is good. Parking is very reasonable, and there is a small gym on campus.
cons: Schedules, vacation requests, working conditions, and pay are all dependent on your supervisor not on whether you do your job well. Nepotism is rampant. Firings are not uncommon. Someone who worked for this company for more than 15 years was walked off the job (fired). Not the most secure place to work.

review_title: Depends what you are looking for
job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: The pay for what you do is pretty good for the area.  Benefits are good and the hours are not bad either.  Non Profit University.
cons:
30 minute lunches, scheduled 15 minute breaks.  You have to earn your vacation first; not allowed to take vacation with no pay; even if the employee wants it. 
You better be liked to be able to advance.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Beautiful campus, loads of upside and potential, family atmosphere among most staff.
cons: Changing dynamic losing focus of true identity and focus on foundational values and mission. Massive restructure led to numerous layoffs. For-profit mentality replacing not-for-profit. Becoming a diploma mill, thus devaluing degrees and almost zero admission standard for education center and online students. Meeting enrollment goals more important to new leadership rather than customer service focus that led to great successes under prior president. Little or no room for career advancement and grossly underpaid staff.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Tampa, FL
pros: Great benefits, quality education, supportive staff
cons: The "call center" at the Channelside location was a horrible place to work. We were practically treated like children and management had zero clue how to manage their employees. Training was non existent. And the few managers who tried to actually manage were conveniently forced out for a more strict and micro-managing choice typically from a for-profit school. Managing a non profit school is entirely different than for-profit and management should have realized this but did not.

review_title: Channelside location is a great place to work!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Tampa, FL
pros: I love the culture and atmosphere with the Center for Online Learning in Channelside! We have the autonomy within our jobs to work independently when needed. We are never pressured to enroll or keep students in classes. In fact we try to find out if the student is a good fit for Saint Leo, and its core values. There are always fun activities planned, and people genuinely seem to like it here.
cons: The uncertainty of a new university president.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: Great benefits and incredible, smart compassionate coworkers. The education is solid and you know you are helping people.
cons: The Channelside location is poorly managed and quietly allows a hostile work environment in the admissions (enrollment counselor) department. Micromanaged environment without a chance to apply creative thinking. Any improvement suggestions made by an employee is seen as negative. Many strong employees aggressively pushed out for creative smart ideas.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Las Vegas, NV
pros: They stress the core values in everything they do.
cons:
The university runs more like a large corporation than a small Catholic university. It’s all about the numbers, and not at all about the students. 

When someone resigns they are never spoken of again. They sort of disappear at lunch and the empty desk is never addressed. You hear “what happened to so and so?” all the time.There is no going away lunch and no card to wish them luck on their next endeavor. Nothing.

Most employees are not Christian and although core values are “stressed,” they are rarely followed. The branding  seems to want to take the Catholic or core values out of all advertisement, which is very disappointing.

review_title: Do not practice what they preach.
job_title: Administrative in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Working to promote education and create a student-centered learning environment has the potential to be rewarding. Pay is decent, and benefits are great.
cons: Senior leadership are only interested in the bottom line and do not really care what's best for students; they don't listen to concerns and input from staff; very high pressure work environment - everyone fears for their job because people get fired so often and so unexpectedly.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great people, relaxed atmosphere, good core values - during previous administration.
cons: New administration making too many missteps: i.e. limiting 403b options, new employees must wait for benefits, limiting health plan options. Enrollment is down and likely to continue to fall under current leadership, technology innovation is being driven by a non-technical group.

review_title: Always a special place, but mid-level management is poor
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: One big family, a fun place to work, always felt like the place was improving, never felt like a number.
cons: Family atmosphere has downsides, horrible work/life balance, manager was too obsessed with leading by the latest leadership book they read - meaning their leadership style changed along with the seasons.

job_title: in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great campus, some really nice students and co-workers that make your job feel worthwhile.  Also there are plenty of events on campus if you don't care for cows.
cons:
Parking sucks.  Be ready to walk.

Lower management is all terrified of losing their jobs.  Most of them would throw you under the bus if it meant saving their hide.  

Don't expect those Core values to be practiced.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Wesley Chapel, FL
pros:
Great Benefits package with assistance in earning a degree and time off
Very Family-Oriented
Extensive training to help overall job success
cons:
Feels like people are promoted based on who they know, and not on overall work ethic or ability
Management at times felt reactive instead of proactive

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Spring Hill, FL
pros: This university is growing at a high rate and there are many opportunities to be part of that growth on many levels. From the grounds crew to faculty and students, everyone is friendly and treat each other as family. Health and employee benefits are very competitive to the current market.
cons: Employee benefits are good but the low salaries deter good talent from being attracted to the university.

review_title: Sad end to a former great university.
job_title: Administrative in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Matching dollars into Retirement account,  Health Reimbursement Account
cons: New leadership moving campus culture from non-profit to for-profit. The changes in culture since former president Arthur Kirk Jr.retired in 2015 are truly horrifying.  Layoffs in 2016 being repeated in 2018. It is now all about the mighty $$ not core values. Preaches work life balance but doesn't practice it.  Sad end to a former great university.  Doubt it will be in business in 5 years on current path.

job_title: Honors Program Work Study in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Was able to work on my own schedule, for the most part, work was simple, had fun at events and interviewing seniors.
cons: Often there was no work to do. Would often only get a few hours of work a pay period.

job_title: Senior Adjunct Professor in Atlanta, GA
pros: I worked at St. Leo as an adjunct for 14 years, the Director and Assistant director are genuine and care about the students.  They also allow the adjunct professors to show how much they care by allowing them to write the curriculum
cons: I ran into a director who did not care just wanted a job.  However she was later fired

job_title: Associate Director in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Benefits, including tuition remission and generous time off. work-life balance for staff members. Student oriented, opportunity to have a positive impact on people's lives
cons: Organizational changes have led to a negative cultural. Organization is top heavy - too many managers, not even workers. Ability to provide high level of customer service has diminished.

job_title: Staff Assistant in Gainesville, FL
pros: Great benifits, tuition remission.  You are able to go to college for free.  Masters degrees available too! You could even complete your PHD.
cons: Hard to take time off at your disclosure.  Sometimes have to work weekends for special college events and purposes.  Sometimes can be hectic.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: They have incredible benefits. They value their employees and treat them right. They give annual cost of living pay increases.
cons:
Pay is a little low like in a lot of Higher Ed. 
During 2016 they are going through a little slump so right now they aren't hiring as much as they used to and the positions they are hiring for are hourly instead of salaried.

job_title: Assistant Director in Atlanta, GA
pros: Faculty and staff were great to work with; adult students returning to finish degrees.  Lots of variety in job description.
cons: The pay was not competitive, but it was the best job I ever  had. You have to have a passion.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in High Springs, FL
pros: This is an extremely professional university and the Gainesville facility has a family atmosphere that is welcoming to all who are involved in the programs.  The staff is extremely competent and caring about the students and faculty and will assist whenever possible.
cons: Due to the adjunct nature of the position, employment is not guaranteed and classes can be cancelled due to low student enrollment.

job_title: Technician in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Easy work, and a pretty nice place to work.  Everyone is friendly.  On site cafeteria (though not free).  On site Gym and Pool as well.
cons: Dealing with people is not a very fun thing to do.  You have to go slow when talking with students because most don't understand what you are trying to say.

job_title: Safety Officer, Event Staff, Dispatcher in Zephyrhills, FL
pros: Saint Leo is a great place to work, as long as you are in the right department. The security department was not one of those unfortunately.
cons: Not professional, gossipy, management lacking in both support and mannerisms. They are right in there with the gossipy clique.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros:
Supportive staff 
supportive management
constructive criticism
helping people achieve their goal of starting school 
recognition for job well done 
executive management encourage feedback and ideas to change 
health benefits are superior to any out there
403b is employer contribution is excellent
cons:
"warm" leads don't pan out 
tedious work 
communication is lacking within departments 
There should be a clear career development path

job_title: Senior Salesforce Developer in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great benefits package, free lunch on first day...
cons: Extremely political organization with departments trying to undermine each other constantly.  When I asked leadership about their vision and goals for the department, *LAUGHTER* was the response.  On my 14th day with the organization, a new platform purchase was announced that would replace the platform I was hired to develop on.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Saint Leo, FL
pros: St. Leo was one of the first adjunct positions I held where I felt fully accepted and respected by full-time faculty. The professional and spiritual ethos of St. Leo made this a great teaching and learning experience.
cons: No cons in my experience!

job_title: Multimedia Specialist in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great benefits, beautiful campus, generally pretty relaxed place
cons: Low pay, depending on department some management is incompetent at best and overtly hostile at worst.

job_title: in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great employees and good benefits.
cons: Change in leadership has created a very toxic, stressful, and hostile work environment across departments. The focus is on increasing the budget and the university's financial crisis. The leadership no longer values what is best for learners. Employees are not respected or appreciated. Leadership expects employees to work long hours and take on more responsibility with little support.

job_title: Newspaper Staff in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great people to work with, very friendly, great benefits. Campus is beautiful, food is decent, and everyone is willing to help each other out.
cons: Budget changes often and pay cuts across the board. Campus is located almost in the middle of nowhere with little housing in the area.

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Tampa, FL
pros: Very relaxed comfortable environment to work in. Very little drama with coworkers.
cons: Management does not manage at all. Busy having there own fun and not trying to build moral or help there team.

job_title: Analyst in Tampa, FL
pros: Great people,  passion for students, and education.
cons: the pressure to meet sales goals. manipulation of data, values of leadership are concerning. Lies and Deceptions within Center of Online Learning

job_title: Mentor in Tampa, FL
pros: Great Environment and friendly Co workers. Company is generous to employees. Retirement package is outstanding. They truly care about the employees.
cons: Low salary. If the starting salary was higher they would retain more employees. The company just needs to increase salary and also add more raises.

review_title: Terrible management. Crude, rude and abusive. Profanity laced tirades
job_title: in Saint Leo, FL
pros: If you have a good manager this could be a decent place to work. Appears room for advancement. Benefits. Main campus offers cafeteria
cons: No good system for complaints re: inappropriate and abusive managers. Unresponsive human resources. No recourse to major issues other than quitting

job_title: IT-Server in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Very nice campus, good people. Vision is good.
cons: IT Directors are some of the worst people I have ever met. Very immature and they have no business being in the position they are in.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Great benefits. Beautiful campus. Plenty of great people.
cons: Some departments have toxic environments, but nothing that most people can't handle.

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Nice campus and low student teach ratio.
cons: They only hire adjuncts and few full time professors.  This tells the seasoned professor that they are not worth the investment.  Its a shame too because I really love working on the campus.

review_title: Horrible. Do not waste your time. Run Away!
job_title: Student Advisor in Tampa, FL
pros: Tuition remission. Benefits. 0 accountability. 0 KPIs. Pretty much kindergarten recess at all times.
cons: The people. The culture. Low Low LOW pay. No raises. No professional growth opportunities.

invested in their employees

friendly atmosphere
good salary and excellent benefits

job_title: Enrollment Counselor in Saint Leo, FL

cons: Incompetent, dishonest, and misleading management, terrible pay, deceptive admission practices, enrollment model mimics for-profit "colleges", underwhelming and sometimes dangerous work environment

job_title: Director in Saint Leo, FL
pros: Strong core values, new CEO, very progressive and forward thinking
cons: Heavy workload; long hours if salaries; expect perfection from employees. Non-conformists aren't employed long.

job_title: in Marietta, GA

review_title: Fun Environment, Good Staff, Pay is Questionable
